Coronavirus: French economy expected to shrink by 11% in 2020 ...  production and sales of electric and hybrid cars is central to Macron's stimulus plan, which includes significant buyer incentives to go green. Its goal is to produce over one million clean-energy vehicles in the country by 2025. READ MORE: France earmarks 8bn stimulus package to support car industry The government also wants its car giants, such as Renault ( RNO.PA ) and the Peugeot Group ( UG.PA ) to focus production in France. Renault is currently in discussions for a state-backed loan of 5bn. The government has also approved a 7bn bailout for flag carrier Air France. What to Read Next On this day... This new car tax change could see motorists opt for a new vehicle over public transport ...  thousands of pounds each year which has been a factor in pushing running costs lower. READ MORE: There's 'never been a better time' to switch, says EV expert Motorists look set to switch to electric cars over using public transport (Image: Getty) Car tax changes scrapped benefit in kind rates for electric cars (Image: Getty) The group says motorists can secure a lease of a new electric Peugeot for just 5,028 with just 2,000 spent on parking. Fuel costs are also considerably lower with an average of 525 spent on an electric vehicle with charges of just four pence per mile. Fuel alone for a diesel car comes in at a staggering 2,500 per year with costs an average of 15 pence per mile. This means running a diesel car costs almost 13,000 a year ...

When Group B Monsters Flew Through Welsh Moors ... the race things were far from decided as far as championships were concerned. After two years of dominance by Audi and Lancia, the field was starting to widen out a little bit. Cars like the Renault 5 Turbo and Toyota Celica TCT were starting to make inroads, winning races, and giving the big players reason for pause. Come the end of the season, though, one challenger stood apart from the rest. One that gave the Germans and Italians goosebumps. Advertisement That was Peugeot. It was in 1985 that Peugeot would be able to come away with a manufacturers' championship for the first time since Group B began, its raucous mid-engined, all-wheel-drive 205 T16s driven to victory by Finns Ari Vatanen and Timo Salonen. But despite all of that excitement surrounding ...

France's Renault highlights obstacles to reshoring industries ...  awaiting a buyer. In the context of Covid-19, "we've got to take into account public utility as well as shareholder value," Coutinet said. "Relocations must be thought of on a case-by-case basis," Louis Gallois, president of French business think-tank La Fabrique de l'Industrie and president of French car manufacturer PSA which owns Peugeot, Citroen and Opel brands told French media network BFM TV. There are possibilities for it to happen in the strategic health, food and digital sectors, Gallois continued. But it's not possible in some sectors such as car manufacturing, he argued, noting that export markets often require local production in exchange for access. "A complete relocation of production processes at a national ...
